page.title: 08Stanton St Quintin School
page.content: In{Victorian}times Stanton School was built. There was only the one building but they put a curtain to divide it into two. We interviewed{Mrs Drew}who was at Stanton School when she was young and she told us about the School. They gave the children cod-liver oil to nourish them. The{lessons}they had were Arithmetic, Scripture, Handicraft (Sewing and Embriodary), Painting, Times Table Test, Spelling Test and Gloy (glueing). The children always wore a{pinafore}to go over their clothes so they would not get them dirty and the pinafore was easier to wash. The children always wore leather shoes and a rubber over-shoe called {galoshes.}The school has still got the {bell}that was on the roof of Mrs Banks class room and it is now in the Library for every one to see it.
